title.value: Improved Robustness Against Adaptive Attacks With Ensembles and Error-Correcting Output Codes
title.justification: This is the title of the paper provided by the user.
title.quote: Improved Robustness Against Adaptive Attacks With Ensembles and Error-Correcting Output Codes

extractions.description: This paper investigates the robustness of Error-Correcting Output Codes (ECOC) ensembles against adaptive adversarial attacks and proposes improvements in their architectural designs and training methods to enhance robustness. The study includes a comprehensive robustness assessment and explores the relationship between ensemble diversity and robustness.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results and robustness assessments conducted on models and datasets to support its claims.
type.quote: We perform a comprehensive robustness assessment against adaptive attacks and investigate the relationship between ensemble diversity and robustness.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on improving robustness against adversarial attacks.
name.quote: Our results demonstrate the benefits of ECOC ensembles for adversarial robustness compared to regular ensembles of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and show why the robustness of previous implementations is limited.

name.justification: The study heavily focuses on using and improving ensembles of neural networks, specifically ECOC ensembles.
name.quote: In this paper, we investigate the robustness of Error-Correcting Output Codes (ECOC) ensembles through architectural improvements and ensemble diversity promotion.

name.justification: The paper involves the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) as base classifiers within the ECOC ensembles.
name.quote: Our results demonstrate the benefits of ECOC ensembles for adversarial robustness compared to regular ensembles of convolutional neural networks (CNNs).

name.justification: The paper focuses on improved robustness against adversarial attacks using ensembles based on Error-Correcting Output Codes (ECOC).
name.quote: We perform a comprehensive robustness assessment against adaptive attacks and investigate the relationship between ensemble diversity and robustness for ECOC ensembles of different architectures.

is_contributed.justification: The paper proposes new architectural improvements and training methods for ECOC ensembles.
is_contributed.quote: In this work, we revisit ECOC ensembles in the context of adversarial robustness through architectural improvements and perform a comprehensive experimental robustness assessment against white-box adaptive attacks.

is_executed.justification: The experiments and assessments in the paper involve actual execution of the models.

referenced_paper_title.value: Error-correcting output codes: A general method for improving multiclass inductive learning programs
referenced_paper_title.justification: This title is referenced as the original work from which the ECOC method is derived.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Error-Correcting Output Codes (ECOC) ensembles are inspired from information theory and were introduced by Dietterich & Bakiri (1994) for solving multi-class learning problems.

name.justification: The dataset CIFAR10 is used in the experiments to assess the robustness of the models.
name.quote: The ECOC models for CIFAR10 are trained for 900 epochs with a learning rate of 10−4 and for 100 additional epochs with a learning rate of 10−5.
